# - A=P(1+r/n)nt
	- A = amount after interest
	- P = principal
	- t = number of years
	- n = times per years
	- r = rate

## invest $100,000 at 6.5% compounded semianually

- in four years
	- A = 100,000(1+.065/2)2*4
	- 129,157.75
- in ten years
	- 189,583.79

## invest 5000 @ .15% compounded quarterly

- in 3 years
	- 5022.55
